text.__SUMMARY__:
Fritillaria kurdica is a Middle Eastern species of bulb-forming plants in the lily family, native to Iran, Iraq, Turkey, and Caucasus. The species is sometimes cultivated in other regions as an ornamental.Fritillaria Kurdica (full name, "Fritillaria Kurdica. Bulletin of Kurdish Studies") is also the name of an academic periodical published in Poland, devoted to the study of the culture and history of the Kurdish People.
